cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)SECRETCP. (U6) 377 COPY NO.11th October, 1 9h6CABINETFOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANISATION PREPARATORY commission memorandum by the Minister of food at the F.A.O. Conferent*e at Copenhagen it was decidedthat a Preparatory Commission should meet in Washington beforethe 1st November to consider Sir John Orr's proposals for a world Food Board, and any alternative proposals submitted bythe member governments of the Food and Agriculture Organisation.It is proposed that the United Kingdom delegation should be comprised as follows:-Leader - J.H. Wilson, O.B.E., M.P., parliamentary secretary, Ministry of Works.Members - Sir John Magowan, K.B.E.,' C.M.G.,Minister (Commercial) BritishEmb army, Wa sh ington.Gordon Munro, C.M.G., TreasuryRepresentative in "Washington.A representative of the Treasury(to assist Gordon Munro)L. Thompson-McCausland, Bank of England(adviser to Treasury representatives)R.R. Enfield, CB., Ministry ofAgricultureA.N. Duckham, Agricultural Attache inWashingtonJ.E. Wall, O.B.E., Ministry, of FoodE. Melville, Colonial OfficeB. Cockram, O.B.E., Dominions Office(stationed in Washington) to act asliaison with Dominion representatives.J* S.Ministry of Food, S.W.1.11th October, 19h7.
